website_summaries.verdict: The AMD Athlon 5350 is a budget processor for PC geeks who prefer to build their own desktops. It's middle-of-the-road in terms of features and performance, but its low price is the main lure.
cons: Slow compared to even low-end Intel and AMD mainstream desktop CPUs
Some Intel platforms have even lower power requirements

customer_reviews.title: Good CPU noisey fan
customer_reviews.text: Good CPU, perfect for surfing in the Internet, watch videos and movies, do homework, social media, office and even some light photoshop and illustrator. The only con is that the fan cooler is noisey
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small, general use PC.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Runs very well when used for general purpose computing (office, email, light gaming). I have not pushed it beyond these applications so I can't say what it would do for video editing or intense gaming. Runs fairly cool with stock fan (50C) - I personally am replacing it with a Zalman low profile fan as a preference. I also use it to stream video and music and have not had any problems with lag at all. Might be good for use in a HTPC.
customer_reviews.author: B. Waldron

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing APU
customer_reviews.text: This little guy packs a huge punch! At first I was using it as an HTPC to check on email, work on my online college classes, watch Netflix, and get on amazon of course. After a while I kept using it more and more. I started using photoshop on it for my photoshop course, Unity for my game dev classes, and even visual studio! After a while I forgot about my other desktop that has an AMD FX inside of it. Just for giggles I ran Blender on it and it handled pretty nice for the most part. My parents are using it now as their computer and so far no complains out of them.
customer_reviews.author: GoodDealJoe

customer_reviews.title: Setup a HTPC running Windows 7, and now Windows ...
customer_reviews.text: Setup a HTPC running Windows 7, and now Windows 10... Works well for streaming, etc... It is a bit slow when multi-tasking(netflix, and a ton of tabs in web browser), but that's kind of expected given the cpu speed.
customer_reviews.author: James Cotter

customer_reviews.title: Alot of Power in a Small APU
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with the AsRock AM1H-ITX. Great combination for a low-power, no gpu htpc. I'm not a gamer butthe cpu has handled everything I've used it for thus far - mainly streaming and office software type functions. and that is with using Windows XP! However since my purchase the Puma/Mullins APUs have come to market and I strongly suggest you look at the newer Kabini Apus before purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: DrNorm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly very surprised by how small this thing was, but despite it's size (and smaller fan to match) it ran quickly and quietly Worked great with Windows 7 home in a budget build for just browsing/emailing
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: Alright for the price.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, 2.05 Ghz won't get your far, but it works well for the price, so I have no complaints. It's slow, but what do you expect from a cheap processor. You can game, just don't play something like an mmorpg that has many, many players, because rendering models is the processors task, and it'll take a dump on your FPS.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great HTPC processor!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this processor in my HTPC for a almost a year now and am very pleased with it. It's perfect for my TV/.movie watching needs. I was a little skeptical about the factory supplied cooling fan, thinking it would be noisy - but it's fine. In fact the power dissipation is quite acceptably low.
customer_reviews.author: madmax

customer_reviews.title: runs cool, and has a capable integrated graphics card
customer_reviews.text: This competes in price with Intel's Pentiums, which have higher single-core performance but are only dual-core. (See  .) This is cheap, runs cool, and has a capable integrated graphics card, so in a modest build with no discrete graphics it's a solid choice. Note that it does include a cooler and thermal paste, so you won't have to buy them separately.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Anderson

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: really low power useage great performance for a HTPC tied up with a HDHOMERUN running Kubuntu 14.04 and 4 gig of ram. I fugured sence it does not have dual channel ability might as well just got one card 4 gig Linux has no problem with this even the AMD proprietary driver works just fine under --buildandinstallpkg. Ive even run Steam+Linux games on it with no hitch.
customer_reviews.author: StevenWR

customer_reviews.title: Good but be aware
customer_reviews.text: I really like most everything about this processor. It is a good, reliable APU. I needed a reliable home computer and this APU fits the bill. The one thing that I did not like is that the graphics on it are a bit weak. When I initially installed it, the graphics were a bit jumpy. The only way to correct it is to change the Bios setting regarding graphics to "force" which apparently over clocks the APU. I chose to purchase a graphics card instead. Now everything runs well. I gave it four stars because it does everything else I need extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Dubord

customer_reviews.title: It has no issues at all keeping up and runs cool. I would definitely recommend this chip if you're ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high expectations for this CPU. But I was blown away by it! I currently have it paired with the ASUS AM1I-A motherboard, 8GB RAM, and a 120GB SSD. It is very snappy. The system runs a file server, VOIP servers (teamspeak and mumble), and a security camera system. It has no issues at all keeping up and runs cool. I would definitely recommend this chip if you're looking for a low cost, low power, but good performing system.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: low power and pretty fast. Don't expect to play high end games ...
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, low power and pretty fast. Don't expect to play high end games on it, but otherwise it's good. I upgraded my HTPC that had an old dual core Athlon to this. I'm happy with the performance, especially considering the price and the power savings. It uses enough less power than my old system to pay for itself in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget man

customer_reviews.title: Enough for normal work, inexpensive, and sips power!
customer_reviews.text: These aren't the fastest, but they sip power and perform great for small workstations that don't get super heavy use. And they just sip tiny amounts of power! No graphics card required either, for just normal work stuff and normal videos. Plus they support hardware virtualization even! Amazingly good chip for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rushing

customer_reviews.title: Powering my HTPC and plays all content (recorded TV vie ...
customer_reviews.text: Powering my HTPC and plays all content (recorded TV vie WMC, YouTube, Netflix) no problem. The heat sink is a little tricky to install but Its been a while since I built a pc so it may be just me. Very zippy little processor just bear in mind this is for low power applications and not playing games or doing photoshop etc.
customer_reviews.author: Krys Kory

customer_reviews.title: Quick and inexpensive processor that will power my new pfSense ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick and inexpensive processor that will power my new pfSense firewall. It might be overkill for a router/firewall, but I wanted to future proof to some extent and this will get me by until the new AM4 stuff is widely available, and can be evaluated.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D. Leik

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: AMD processors are the best hands down. LOVE this processor. No disappointments here either.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great. Fan is quiet
customer_reviews.text: Great. Fan is quiet. Runs everything I need it to on an emulator box/media PC. Graphics are adequate for emulation and most applications. Low power usage, low temp. Included heat-sink and fan are more than enough to cool it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: kudos
customer_reviews.text: So far this is one of the best bang for buck processors I've seen. Great for low budget desktops. I've built a few gaming rigs with these that perform OK; however, if you want serious performance, you may want to keep scrolling to the FX 6300 or higher.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Biggalow

customer_reviews.title: I paired this with an ASRock AM1H-ITX motherboard, a ...
customer_reviews.text: I paired this with an ASRock AM1H-ITX motherboard, a Crucial SSD and 4GB RAM. For a small form factor PC it flies! Very inexpensive to build, and it does everything we need it to, from Facebook to email to watching movies and netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great low-power CPU, I used it for my new HTPC/NAS build
customer_reviews.text: Great low-power CPU, I used it for my new HTPC/NAS build. Easy to install, works fast enough for 1080p transcoding. Other components are: - hec Black 0.7mm Thickness SECC (Japanese Steel Metal) ITX ITX200B Mini ITX Media Center / HTPC Case - MSI AM1I AM1 2 x SATA 6Gb/s USB 3.0 HDMI Mini ITX AMD Motherboard - AMD Athlon 5350 AD5350JAHMBOX 2.05 GHz Quad-core Desktop Processor - Crucial Ballistix Sport 8GB Single DDR3 1600 MT/s PC3-12800 CL9 1.5V UDIMM 240-Pin Memory (BLS8G3D1609DS1S00) - WL 6TB 5700RPM 64MB Cache 5700RPM SATA III (6.0Gb/s) 3.5" Internal Hard Drive (Desktop PC, CCTV DVR, NAS) - w/1 Year Warranty
customer_reviews.author: Dosby

customer_reviews.title: I have this little bad boy running my second HTPC build (had an i3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this little bad boy running my second HTPC build (had an i3 4130 running my first). This one fit the bill perfectly for my needs. Excellent performance with windows 8.1, xbmc, kodi, Netflix streaming etc.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSnyp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing performance for only 41$! I can play any old game I want, Source games (TF2, CS:GO, G-Mod), Minecraft, and Robocraft, with FPS never dropping below 30! Plus, this things TDP is only 25W so it keeps very cool at 48C even under load.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxson

customer_reviews.title: Value King
customer_reviews.text: AMD is still the value king! The 5350 makes a great media PC. Stock cooler it's fine if you are able to throttle it. At full speed, the fan is loud, but with MSI smart fan control it's mostly inaudible.
customer_reviews.author: twofive0

customer_reviews.title: Low power footprint for average usage
customer_reviews.text: Certainly it's not the performance king in any perceptive. But it handles average desktop usage very well: web browsing, photo management, HD playback etc. The cooler and heat sink resembles the old way, which may pose a small challenge to fit on. But not an impossible task, 20min at most should be enough for anyone to get it done properly. Still curiously wondering 3D performance? Roughly 5FPS in Heaven Benchmark 4.0 at Ultra setting on a 1080 monitor.
customer_reviews.author: He Zong Yuan

customer_reviews.title: Good but
customer_reviews.text: I was on a major buget for my pc if your doing everyday stuff besides gaming I recommend this for you but with gaming this proccessor is a major bottle neck
customer_reviews.author: Justin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Works OK, but it's not cheap compared to an ...
customer_reviews.text: Works OK, but it's not cheap compared to an FM2+ mainline processors. There is little value in going this route in a build-your-own computer.
customer_reviews.author: Paul_Krue

customer_reviews.title: perfect for a first build!
customer_reviews.text: Good for a first build, thou I ended up upgrading down the road to an fx-8350 black edition. That was a HUGE performance jump.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Good for small ESXi host
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good so far, it support AMD Virtualization so I'm using it on an ESXi host and seems to be performing very well with 5 or 6 running VMs at the moment, I'm planning to put 10 or so VMs into this host.
customer_reviews.author: DSR

customer_reviews.title: This chip is powerful enough for 70% of all PC ...
customer_reviews.text: This chip is powerful enough for 70% of all PC users, all while using less power than a 30 watt light bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bhut

customer_reviews.title: Love this cpu!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I am really impressed with this lil cpu. It streams video without breaking a sweat! It is very snappy when paired with my 120gig SSD and single 4gig ram stick. Here are my WEI scores to use as a basic base line: 6.3, 5.9, 5.0, 6.2, 7.9.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great low Has kept my wife and I entertained without breaking the bank on hardware or electricity. -power media PC CPU.
customer_reviews.text: Great low-power media PC CPU. Has kept my wife and I entertained without breaking the bank on hardware or electricity. Also nice as an extra couple of cores for distcc compilation.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Zane Chudgar

customer_reviews.title: Super low power Win 7 Media Center
customer_reviews.text: I own three of these they are all used for Media Centers around the house and pull only 15 watts when plugged in to an Asrock AM1H-ITX with 1 stick of DDR3 ram and an SSD and a Laptop PSU.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot O. Loney

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect out of the box...no issues. Not really fast but otherwise works well. Proprietary AMD graphics drivers for Linux got me a black screen so I had to go with the open source drivers.
customer_reviews.author: WH7QQ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value. Performance about on par with a Q6600
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value. Performance about on par with a Q6600, but also has a solid integrated GPU and uses only 25W!
customer_reviews.author: Juniper

customer_reviews.title: Fan attachment.
customer_reviews.text: The cpu is great. What I have a problem with is the screws to get it inside the mobo. The fan is connected to the screws so I just use electric tape to put the fan in. I've tried for an hour at least and I can't get it.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: great low-to-mid-level cpu
customer_reviews.text: My requirements were pretty basic. Browse the internet, windows 8.x, run office 2013. I have no problems with this cpu and 8 GB memory. Runs like a champ. No noticeable lags
customer_reviews.author: Wrath

customer_reviews.title: Low Power, runs cool, reliable, and an all-around winner
customer_reviews.text: What gem of a CPU! This CPU is very power efficient. It has a small fan on it, but that is because it runs cool and uses very little power. Nice CPU for a media station or general purpose computing. I think I'll get another.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Moore

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations, although its not the best processor for gaming it worked perfectly for the games I ran with it. I have had no problems with this CPU.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyG

customer_reviews.title: good video embedded in CPU
customer_reviews.text: very cost efficient , works well ( fast enough ) multi core, good video embedded in CPU, 64 bit, very low energy usage, low operating temp
customer_reviews.author: William F Baltas

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these things
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these things. They make good general use computers or Plex servers. There are other uses of course, these are my primary ones though!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hopfensperger

customer_reviews.title: i glad to upgraded
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from 3508 to 5350, i glad to upgraded, for Ubuntu and KDE as well, This good for everyday--email,movie,browser, and small games, not large gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Jose R.

customer_reviews.title: better than any of the Intel J series chips in ...
customer_reviews.text: better than any of the Intel J series chips in my opinion .. pair it up with a SSD makes for a super fast system
customer_reviews.author: LSA

customer_reviews.title: wow nuff said
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a PC build just for running Kodi for in the living room and I love it it's actually really Snappy for it what it is
customer_reviews.author: dylan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the budget build
customer_reviews.text: Faster than I thought. Will play 1920x1080@60fps video with no issues. Perfect for the budget build. You can put together a pretty snappy computer for $200 running Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome performance/price balance. Built a full workstation for $200 using this. Performance is great for workstations.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler D.

customer_reviews.title: Runs COOL. Integrated graphics
customer_reviews.text: Decent entry level processor. Runs COOL. Integrated graphics? Nah you cant go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Khan

customer_reviews.title: Great For Grandma
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for a non-power user. Plenty sufficient for browsing, viewing videos, etc. No need to spend more.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ramone

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Ubuntus Unity 3D desktop too
customer_reviews.text: Runs Ubuntu with a webserver, DB, PLEX media center all very smoothly...As far as I can tell without doing benchmarks it seems to do everything almost as quickly as my much more powerful desktop. Works fine with Ubuntus Unity 3D desktop too. Not tried games but then if that's what you're after this probably isn't the CPU you're looking for. Pretty much silent too.
customer_reviews.author: grime

customer_reviews.title: Great for htpc
customer_reviews.text: Love this little APU! I use it in my htpc using a ASRock Motherboard Micro AM1H-ITX motherboard powered by a LITEON PA-1900 19v power supply. Streams 1080p live TV and movies using only about 10% CPU at 60FPS. OS is OpenELEC 5.0.6.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Its very good compared to other processors and its price is very ...
customer_reviews.text: Its very good compared to other processors and its price is very good, however I would not recommend this to pepele who play BF4, Planetside 2, or games that use more processing power, BF3 ran well, and CSGO was perfect for this processor(I got over 70 to mid 90s frames per second. good for a building your first PC
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from a Sempron 2650
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade from a Sempron 2650. I'm running pfSense on this, and it handles OpenVPN over my 150Mbps at full speed without breaking a sweat. In general, I'd recommend this platform to anyone looking for a cheap but relatively powerful HTPC, basic desktop system, or small home server. Four cores, good graphics (though I don't use them currently), AES-NI support for firewalls. It's not a world beater, but for $70 for CPU and motherboard you can't beat it. And it's been cool, quiet, and perfectly reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Good SteamOS CPU
customer_reviews.text: Best AM1 CPU, would recommend for use in a desktop. Can play minecraft (kinda) and is great for steamOS.
customer_reviews.author: Thanin Ong

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a ASUS Mini ITX DDR3 1600 Motherboard, and windows 7, as the person I built this for preferred Windows 7 to 8.1. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: James J

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Strong CPU for the price. Using it for home built NAS. Not sure I would use it for a desktop even if it was just email web browsing.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Fast fix
customer_reviews.text: Runs like a new computer ,highly recommend to all repair people.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is awesome, functions flawlessly and is running our media server very well!
customer_reviews.author: BrycenMTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Impressive low cost processor
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this processor. Built in graphics perform well. I don't have it in a machine that I ask alot of. So what I do ask it to do, video playback and online streaming, it does well. Cooling fan more than adequate. Easy install.
customer_reviews.author: tightwad dave

customer_reviews.title: Just Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing processor. I never expected the performance at this low price $50 !!!
customer_reviews.author: GLTSA

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little processor for day to day task of streaming video.
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Runs fast and cool - no issues with BIOS - Gigabyte AM1M-S2H-AM1 board
customer_reviews.text: No drama on initial boot up - PC runs very cool and snappy - nice chip for a HTPC. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: dougiestyletone

customer_reviews.title: The best words you can find
customer_reviews.text: Fast, cheap, and reliable. The best words you can find. I use this to host a PleX media server. It transcodes like a champ, usually 4+ 1080P connections at the same time without any hickups.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Allen

customer_reviews.title: works great, would purchase from seller
customer_reviews.text: Received as advertised, works great, would purchase from seller again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with this little cpu perfect for HTPC, heatsink is surprisingly quiet
customer_reviews.author: DZ2012

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: Fast and amazing processor. I use (am is using it currently) with a budget build and a Micro ATX motherboard. Nice job AMD!
customer_reviews.author: B Malin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and kids play all there games on it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M Breaux

customer_reviews.title: AMD comes through with another fantastic value price product
customer_reviews.text: As always, AMD comes through with another fantastic value price product. Works as expected and stable.
customer_reviews.author: superthaix

customer_reviews.title: Better than ever.
customer_reviews.text: super fast and super affordable. Beats an i7 I feel.
customer_reviews.author: CC2015

customer_reviews.title: Best performance to price processor to build a home Linux firewall / server.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this an a Micro-ATX motherboard and built a nice Fedora Linux firewall. Plenty of horsepower at a great price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation. Works pretty well for simple machines for internet browsing and word processing.
customer_reviews.author: TJ H

customer_reviews.title: absolutely awesome, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished building my PC with this processor, and I have to say I am simply amazed at how quick this processor is handling. Going to run it through some tests and see how it handles.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Low power usage and fast enough for email and office work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance For The Money, Low Power Consumption, Little Heat
customer_reviews.text: For the money this processor is fantastic. Almost as fast as my Phenom II X4 955, and consumes only a fraction of the power. The idle temperature is lower than normal human body temperature. Windows 7 x64 works flawlessly. Can't ask for much more. I used this to build a budget PC with an SSD and 8GB of RAM. Another great thing is that aftermarket coolers are really quiet due to the relative lack of need for intense cooling. Can't comment on the stock cooler since I didn't install it.
customer_reviews.author: CAK

customer_reviews.title: Had my doubts, but this processor is excellent!
customer_reviews.text: It can transcode two simultaneous 1080p streams via Plex (locally) quietly and efficiently. I did slightly overclock it using the Asus motherboard maybe that's why.
customer_reviews.author: Nik Mici

customer_reviews.title: Best of AM1
customer_reviews.text: Pros -enough processing power for 7th gen games (Xbox360 and PS3 quality) -very low power consumption compared to FM2(+) and AM3(+) -most powerful AM1 processor Cons -Integrated graphics are absolute garbage for gaming (even 2D games), although a graphics card fixes this nicely Other thoughts Good for budget build or low power consumption build. I use a EVGA NVIDIA GTX 750Ti SC 2GB GDDR5 RAM for a video card and it runs well with the processor. I haven't run many demanding games on the computer though it does run Sanctum 2 on max settings with no visible frame skip.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Lashinski

customer_reviews.title: For budget builds that delivers performance!
customer_reviews.text: For budget builds, this quad processor is better choice than getting the expensive Intel ones. Definitely not for gaming but performs snappily in browsing multiple web pages and watching streaming videos . I was able to watch simultaneously two Netflix movies in two browser windows without lag just to test video performance.
customer_reviews.author: MrRhyne

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for a low power CPU
customer_reviews.text: Great performance for a low power CPU. I'm using it in a HTPC running Windows 8.1 Pro along with 2 VM's, FreeNAS and FreePBX.
customer_reviews.author: Arion C

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Low heat. Perfect for HTPC.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my HTPC from a slower dual core Atom processor and figured I'd give the AMD APUs a shot. This thing is very snappy and generates very little heat. I was a little leery at first because the heat sink seems a little chintzy and the fan was very small. Small fans tend to make a bit more noise from my experience. However, I was happy to notice that the fan was nearly silent and everything was moving a long much quicker than the Atom D2550 I had.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: great for a mini-itx build
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my recent XBMC mini-itx build. System runs very well while pulling only 12w from wall when idle, 20w while watching 1080p tv/movies.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Ready for HTPC !!!
customer_reviews.text: Very good cost benefit for a HTPC and low cost desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Guga

customer_reviews.title: Runs pretty well but I've since found out I paid way ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this APU an ASUS AN1N A board. Runs pretty well but I've since found out I paid way too much. These are going for a lot less. AMD site lists prices from 27.99 to 49.00 really surprised Amazon wasn't cheaper. [...]
customer_reviews.author: K DeSantis

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little processor for what it is I can even play Crysis on it and Battlefield 4 I paired it with a 750 TI graphics card, a ECS KAM1-l mobo, 8gb ram, 430w Evga psu and a 500gb HD all in a Cooler Master Elite 130 case. Running Windows 10 and its snappy, i have it setup as a HTPC. Had for over a year now i think.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Cool, Efficient, Fast Enuf, Cheap to run. Dig it.
customer_reviews.text: Coolest CPU on the planet. I have three of these things running full time. They are quiet and efficient enough to push files through the wireless routers. Easy to mount. Easy to cool. Cheap to leave running. These things just work, and they are cheap. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: wjcunning

customer_reviews.title: Awsome HTPC system core
customer_reviews.text: Working flawlessly paired with an ASRock AM1H-ITX (DC), this thing plays 1080p flawlessly and records TV, sometimes at the same time. Paired with an OCZ SSD and W7 Home. The 25 W draw makes for a quiet system even with the stock fan
customer_reviews.author: JD the tired dad

customer_reviews.title: ... for a couple bucks it runs a nas perfectly fine as long as you use network cards that do ...
customer_reviews.text: Processor is a complete dog but what do you expect for a couple bucks it runs a nas perfectly fine as long as you use network cards that do not tax the cpu
customer_reviews.author: Pole Pot

customer_reviews.title: It was just too slow to play league of legends ...
customer_reviews.text: It was just too slow to play league of legends at an adequate frame rate and any build with this costs to much to be a worthwhile htpc. Basically it's cheap if you want something for Linux internet surfing or something
customer_reviews.author: Alex G.

customer_reviews.title: Low Power Solution, not very good Video
customer_reviews.text: Runs cooooool. Onboard video is a bit jerky for streaming video but playback from local HDD is good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Amedee

customer_reviews.title: Great APU for office workstations
customer_reviews.text: Great APU for office workstations! Easy to install, even in case! I don't much care for the pressure it takes to install the fan, but its a minor problem with and otherwise stellar workstation APU.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Got a 5.0 Windows Index Score for CPU. Runs hot. Not recommended.

customer_reviews.title: ... got this processor for a HTPC build and its perfect. Low power and it can run windows 7 ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this processor for a HTPC build and its perfect. Low power and it can run windows 7 very fast with 8 gigs of ram.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: And very good service as a shop
customer_reviews.text: Everything came as it had to come. And very good service as a shop.
customer_reviews.author: Ambioris

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive processor but lacks performance
customer_reviews.text: A good processor for a computer that only does light work, I tried to use this for my file and media server but it was noticeably slower than a dual core Intel processor. For the price, this processor is very good but it seriously lacks in performance.
customer_reviews.author: Miles D

customer_reviews.title: ... in my bum and immediately started processing data at super high speeds
customer_reviews.text: Stuck this in my bum and immediately started processing data at super high speeds...the only CPU that has ever worked in my meat socket.
customer_reviews.author: colemanc

customer_reviews.title: It is low end!
customer_reviews.text: It is low end! Video sucks, takes 4-ever to load a spread sheet and constant IE errors (a web page has caused Internet Explorer to close and reopen...)

customer_reviews.title: Poor processor.
customer_reviews.text: the APU line of processors are junk in my opinion. I would never buy an APU line again. AMD really failed with this line of processor.

customer_reviews.title: Great apu
customer_reviews.text: Great apu for lite usage: office, streaming movies, simple tasks and even lite gaming.
